page.title: 19HIGH HURSTWOOD'S FUTURE? (1)
page.content: Because our block lies just North of the pub, Village Hall and all council housing, we can only report on the way of life of those who live in the larger highly-priced private houses or on farms. Properties here have been bought by the relatively well-off who are attracted by the beautiful surroundings but do not necessarily contribute to village life. They can afford to run several cars and work and spend their leisure time elsewhere. However many of these residents were drawn to the area some years ago precisely because it was a small community and they, as much as those (very few) whose families have always lived locally, regret the demise of features such as the shop which go to make up a real village.A drastic rduction of numbers in the School can only be a threat to its
